intro: Phaius celebicus, commonly known as the Celebes orchid, is a species native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It is a terrestrial orchid characterized by its tall, erect stems and large, showy flowers. The plant typically blooms in the summer months, producing bright yellow or orange flowers with a distinctive hooded lip. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. The botanical features of Phaius celebicus make it a striking addition to botanical gardens and a subject of interest for orchid enthusiasts.
